comments.commentBody:
RE: Cut the cookie

As per Grandmom, the older, more responsible brother gets the knife with which to cut, and the younger (baby) one gets to choose first.

If you plan on participating in this ritual, be prepared to wait a while, 'tis an exacting process.

Whenever Grandmom baked cookies, I carried a micrometer in my back pocket.

Next to the slide rule. (It was a long time ago, yes...)
The Old Man is taking the Kid to school.

It may sound like a good sport to belittle economics and economists in the current socioeconomic climate. But before declaring the field as undeserving of a Nobel Prize, it is helpful to note that economics ideas, unlike ideas in the physical sciences, are often filtered, reworked and distorted beyond recognition in the process of passing through the convoluted world of politics. Physics and chemistry are spared such contamination for political expediency. It is bad enough for economists and their ideas to be appropriated as the currency of today's pocket-book politics. We have no government by economists; and we have no reason to hold them responsible for the mess that society is in.

Hearing all of the rabid anti business comments by NYT readers ( who, of course, ignore the government's  regulatory responsibility in disasters like this) coupled with the remarks of the Hungarian  poster #69 who explained how the Hungarian government was enacting two laws today ( one, to "take away the licenses of the remaining  opposition;" and two, "using sludge as a pretext " the government is " self-awarding" itself to "nationalize any private enterprise they wish") makes me very fearful that all of this  anti capitalist blather we've been reading in NYT comments is where these far left fools are planning to take America!   Shades of "don't waste a crisis" mentality of the Obama administration!    Hurry November!
Good. Arrest the corporate criminals. Now let's do the same thing in the USA.

Love comments like #74 who blame the "banksters" for "releasing financial sludge."  This is such a left wing manipulation.   How about the fact that all of this  financial mess started when left wing groups like Acorn ( oh, thank you George Soros for all of your "secret" funded groups which   knowingly but so "anonymously"   tsunamied  us into the current economic distaster!! Strange how the left is now targeting the conservatives for adopting these manipulative   political strategies!!)    pressured banks with bull horned protests because the banks were being  "prejudiced" against the "poor."  Yes, these poor "poor" people were the very ones who could not repay their loans ( big surprise!)  and started the domino effect   which caused the total economic collapse!  And now, the very people who created the crisis  are blaming the very people they forced to  give the loans to begin with!   What a country!   The biggest failure of the banks was refusing to say "no" to  those  shaky loans to begin with!    (Why did they do that??  That's the real subject that needs all of those congressional investigations)   But we know that that would not have been "politically correct" in this era of  feeling sorry for the criminal instead of his victim. And feeling  that the "poor" are entitled to share the "wealth" of anyone who has more than they do.  An era of "how crazy and dysfunctional can be become?"     Too bad  "common sense" wasn't viewed as an "entitlement!"

comments.userLocation: Metro New York on New Jersey Side of it
comments.commentBody: Interesting and surpising info this is. As for me I found that I'm in the middle of this and have no clue which side I will ultimate head up on. Haven't really done any serious learning and researching on this or etc as well. Basically, its a huge subject and etc.
How do you say oppression in French?  The French love to wag their finger at the US but the difference between the two countries is about the width of two hairs.

American women have the choice of slighting their children to keep their jobs. Their children do not have subsidized day care unless you consider underpaid illegal aliens a subsidy. Most working women in the US place their children in day care centers staffed by poorly educated and poorly paid women. The childrren do not have an uplifting experience. I am now 55 and I would much rather had my daughter in the French system than in the American system. I never got to be a true mother when she was small; I was too desperate trying to work, pay rent and child care. Oh, I did not have money to pay for her medicine either. I did not have health insurance even though I worked. I would have preferred the French system.

Poor men were for close to a century or more burdened with having to bring home the bacon.
Now women have to share in the burden - all to buy more stuff and ignore their children who are left to eat themselves to obesity and be raised by the least literate and educated of care givers. WHY ????????? to buy more stuff to stuff up the planet or afford the minimcmansion.

I think we will see a backlash. Many more people opting for one point five career households in whatever mix of man/femail male/male, female/femaile, male/female/female WHATEVER aportionment.
French women have an amazing setup!  Support, and style... and they're complaining that they're not drudging away in the top boardroom positions?  Ladies, you have the best life possible right now.

Government shouldn't be in the business of picking out certain groups of people for economic help at the exclusion of other groups based on race, sex, and gender. Should a single father be excluded from government help becuase he is the wrong sex, because that is what we are doing at the moment.

n regards to the much vaunted results of the “Global Gender Gap Report”, there's a slight problem with that (actually there are several). Any score under 1 signifies not simply gender inequality, but specifically anti-female inequality. So obviously, any score over 1 signifies anti-male inequality, right? Wrong. There are no scores over 1. You see, according to the Global Gender Gap Report, any time a nation favors men, it's called gender inequality, which is bad, and any time a nation favors women it's called "equality" which "from a values and social justice perspective... is long overdue."

Here's an example from the 2009 report. Turn to page 184 which is where the figures for the United States are to be found. Under "Educational Attainment," we see the four subcategories I mentioned previously. Men and women are equal in the literacy subcategory, but in each of the other three - primary, secondary and tertiary education - there is a higher percentage of girls and women than boys and men. So clearly, according to the criteria laid down by the Report, girls and women do better than boys and men in education in the United States. Ergo, the country's score in this category is 1 which signifies "equality." Inequality equals equality. See how it works?

According to that scoring methodology, if a nation sent only girls to school and denied boys any form of education at all, male and female education would be considered equal. That nation would receive the coveted score of 1.

I was a single mother for six years in Germany, now I am a mother of three, married, in the US. As a free lance TV journalist being a mother has been challenging in both countries. Work places are male dominated. The few women who hold executive positions have either no children, or they are in a position in which someone else can look after there kids whilst they pursue a career.
Having said that, i would choose Germany over the US any time. Having a career will be difficult no matter where. But having reliable health care and publicly financed education for my kids is price less.

In a relatively short period of time women have gone from deficits, to parity, to even surpluses. No sensible person would find much to complain about here. The problem is that many laws that were put in place to bring about these gains (and the thinking behind them) tended to ignore the fact that in gender relations- women are not islands.

We all want families (not just women) to be protected against violent, but enacting laws like VAWA that rob men of due process to supposedly help women and children is counterproductive and anti-women.

We all want girls to have equal opportunities to education, but enacting a system that essentially does to boys what was done to girls is counterproductive and anti-women.

We all want women to be paid fairly for equal work, but enacting laws like the Paycheck Equality Act is counterproductive and anti-women.

Moreover, Paycheck Equality Act, which is mostly based on the idea that women are performing jobs that are of "comparable worth" to jobs performed by men, but are not equally compensated in the form of wages, and would address this by forcing employers to "provide equal pay for jobs that are comparable in skill, effort, responsibility and working conditions." And the acts are specifically designed to force comparisons of completely different jobs in different industries: a typical example is comparing what nurses (who are usually female) make in comparison to truck drivers (usually men).

When Feminists and their policy maker allies start eschewing entitlement for true fairness and equality, the backlash will cease- at least in the U.S. .

Equality between men and women is not achievable, because men and women are apples and oranges.

The politically-correct aim for 'equality' between 'men' and 'women' is not achievable.

It is absolutely impossible.

It will never be found.

It will never be discovered.

It will never happen.

The search for 'equality' between 'men' and 'women' is fuelling a never-ending war between 'men' and 'women'.
The more aggressive and energetic is this nonsensical search for 'equality' between 'men' and 'women' , the more aggressive and energetic will be the war (i.e. the hostility) between 'men and 'women'.
To try to highlight this, notice that there is no 'equitable' solution even to this very simple question ...

Question: Should 'women' have more votes than 'men'?
For those who think, Yes, (because there are more women voters than men voters) then it follows that they also believe that those in a minority should have less of a say in what affects them.
They believe that the largest group (women) should have the greatest power.
As such, 'equality' between 'men' and 'women' is already lost.

For those who think, No, (because this would be unfair on 'men') then it follows that they also believe that those in the majority should have less of a say in what affects them.

They believe that the individual vote of a woman should be worth less than that of a man.
As such, 'equality' between 'men' and 'women' is already lost.
The search for 'equality' between 'men' and 'women' is like a dog chasing its own tail. It will always be out of reach. And the very act of chasing it is costing us a great deal and causing tremendous damage to us.

The solution that we need to seek is not 'equality' - because it will never be found.

The best that can be hoped for is that people are happy with what is happening.

For example, if I had to answer the question, "Should 'women' have more votes than 'men'?" I would say, Yes (because there are more women voters than men voters).

But I would not be saying Yes in order to achieve 'equality'. I would be saying Yes because, currently, it seems to be the better option - for the sake of peace, if nothing else.

And this, in fact, is what all this nonsense about 'equality' between 'men' and 'women' should really boil down to.

If men and women are equally happy with whatever is the issue of concern, then, if you like, some version of 'equality' has been achieved.

But the state of people's happiness actually depends to a very large extent on the propaganda that envelops them.
If the propaganda tells them that they are badly off then their happiness levels will fall and their aggression levels will rise. If the propaganda tells them that they are doing well then their happiness levels will rise and their aggression levels will fall.

And so if people want 'men' and 'women' to be happy about each other then they need - amongst other things - to do their best to destroy all those forces that seek 'equality' between 'men' and 'women' - because these forces will, in practice, forever be creating hostility between 'men' and 'women' while in pursuit of an impossible goal!

Finally, neither men nor women need to be 'equal' to each other in order to be happy with each other.

The next barriers to fall will be those that face men. While women have broken both barriers put upon them by society and themselves, men remain largely trapped by societal expectations (from both men and women) that run counter to expectations of many Feminists, women, and supposedly liberated men

So essentailly you are saying men are destrcutive and females are constructive!?

People need to remeber that just like women, men have expectations put on them by not just men, but other women. I don't see that acknowlegement by the sociey at large cocnerning men.
Old Man Favre has turned it on in the second half.  Need to hawk the ball a bit more and hopefully score a second TD to put the game out of Favre's reach.
Braylon Edwards: Looks great and then looks horrible. When he misses he looks like the worst klutz...he should get his eyes checked.
Old Man Favre throws the TD that decides the game.  Brings back memories of the championship game, that does.

I'm co-sleeping with our younger baby and it has made a world of difference in terms of our sleep. She sleeps better and so do i. It is much faster for me to roll over and nurse her than it would be for either me or my husband to give her a bottle. We started co-sleeping when our older daughter was about 8 months. it was accidental--I was too tired to get her back into her crib. Co-sleeping meant we could sleep in on weekends and take family naps. It was a sad day when that stopped working with our older daughter!

For those who complain that co-sleeping means no intimate time with your spouse a) you can have sex other places b) you can have the baby sleep somewhere else until their first night waking and then bring them to bed, which is what we do.

Babies sleep very well cuddled up with their warm source of food. Wouldn't we all? It isn't perfect every night--there are nights I roll over to a very awake "ba ba ba" and a desire to play at 5AM. But in general, we all sleep more, and are all happier. I'm not sure I could work, parent two kids, and nurse without it.
This is an evil, evil man - both financially and politically.  It is not remarkable at all that he is allied with the Democrats.

Soros was behind the 2008 market crash. Taking advantage of Barney Frank and Chris Dodd's effort to bring in Mark to Market, and remove the Uptick Rule in 2007, Soros went into high gear. He hired hedge fund managers skilled in short selling. In addition Soros networked with foreign sovereign wealth funds to start pulling money out of US institutions starting in July 2008 to put more pressure on them in order to drop asset valuation and stock price. At the same time through organizations he helps fund, and uses to funnel funds through, Soros provided millions of dollars to the Obama campaign a lot of that from overseas. Obama attacks the Chamber of Commerce about foreign $$$, but it is he who profited from it.
Soros put millions out of work. Many took their own lives afterwards. Soros is guilty of manslaughter and after the next election he should be forced to testify under oath about this in Congress and the Senate. Afterwards his close connection to the Obama campaign, and Administration should be investigated as well.

Georgie sitting this one out? I think not. Obama is his boy. Just check out the Center for American Progress. During the Gulf oil spill, Soros dictated Obama's response. Soros had Obama shut down drilling in the Gulf. At he same time, Obama was lending billions to Brazilian oil company Petrobras to continue deep water drilling. Soros had already invested nearly a billion of his own money to this company. Why would Obama do this? My guess is that Obama will become super rich after his one term fiasco for doing Soro's bidding.
Why not?Just go to the Chinese,like Bill did in '96.
